text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSCondition

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSCondition 0..*BaseCondition model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
identifier 0..*IdentifierC.15.1 - Identifier
description 0..1NarrativeC.15.2 - Description
code 0..1CodeableConceptC.15.3 - Code
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): ICD-10*, SNOMED CT, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

onsetDate 0..1dateTimeC.15.4 - Onset date
endDate 0..1dateTimeC.15.5 - End date
category 0..*CodeableConceptC.15.6 - Category
clinicalStatus 0..1CodeableConceptC.15.7 - Clinical status
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 Condtion-clinical

resolutionCircumstances 0..*CodeableReference(Resource)C.15.8 - Resolution circumstances
severity 0..1CodeableConceptC.15.9 - Severity
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 Condtion-severity

anatomicLocation 0..*CodeableReference(Body structure model)C.15.10 - Anatomic location
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT


stage 0..*CodeableConceptC.15.11 - Stage
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): e.g. TNM, ICD-O-3, Bi-Rads, Li-Rads, …


patient 1..1Reference(Patient model | Group model)C.15.12 - Subject
participant 0..*BaseC.15.13 - Participant
function 0..1CodeableConceptC.15.13.1 - Function
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): To be specified

actor 1..1Reference(Health professional model)C.15.13.2 - Actor
externalResourceRelatedWith 0..*uriC.15.14 - External Resource related with
diagnosisAssertionStatus 0..1CodeableConceptC.15.15 - Diagnosis assertion status
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 Condition-ver-status


Documentation for this format

name: EHDSCondition
title: Condition model
description: C.15 - EHDS refined base model for A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

element.definition: C.15 - EHDS refined base model for A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.
Condition identifier
Condition specification in narrative form
Code identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis

binding.description: ICD-10*, SNOMED CT, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

element.definition: Onset date of a problem/condition
The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission.
Category or categories of the problem.
Status of the condition/problem (active, resolved, inactive, ...)

Describes the reason for which the status of the problem changed from current to inactive (e.g. surgical procedure, medical treatment, etc.). This field includes "free text" if the resolution circumstances are not already included in other fields such as surgical procedure, medical device, etc., e.g. hepatic cystectomy (this will be the resolution circumstances for the problem "hepatic cyst" and will be included in surgical procedures).
A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
The anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.
Stage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.
Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.
Who or what participated in the activities related to the condition and how they were involved.
Type of participant involvement.
Identify the Health Professional who may be specifically related to the condition, e.g., as a preferred contact.
Identify the External Resource which may be specifically relatedto the problem, for example a link between a rare disease problemand the corresponding guidelines.
Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
